subject: Ethics
title: War Refugees and Obligations
description: A quick, practical guide to War Refugees and Obligations.

hook.text: 80 million people are currently displaced by war. That's more than the population of Germany.

buildup.text: The 1951 Refugee Convention says nations cannot return refugees to countries where they face persecution.

discovery.text: The principle of non-refoulement is the cornerstone of international refugee protection.

twist.text: Rich nations spend billions on border walls but a fraction on refugee camps where millions live for decades.

climax.text: The ethical question isn't whether refugees deserve help. It's why countries that start wars don't pay.

punchline.text: We created the refugees, then closed the door. That's the shame.

quiz.question: What does the principle of non-refoulement protect?
options: The right of nations to refuse entry to any non-citizen
Refugees from being returned to countries where they face persecution
Soldiers from being forced to fight in unjust wars
